positive.review: Get the Stainless Steel mod, never have to play another medieval strategy game again

Despite its age (19 years old at the time of writing) this game it still excellent and I highly recommend it to all war game fans. Be warned, though. It will eat up all your spare time. I have devoted over a thousand hours to it, and I can't see me stopping any time soon.  Enjoy!

One of my all time favourites. Graphics are dated of course but frankly if you're busy zoomed in watching your infantry slog it out then you're problem missing enemy cav smashing your archers. There are so many features in this missing from newer Total Wars. Crusades/Jihad, population, unlimited build slots, sending units around without generals. It's pretty easy (unmodded at least), but unlike other game franchises it doesn't feel like Med 2 has been made irrelevant by later releases. It still stands strong and will always be worth checking out regardless of which game you started out on.

Great game as old as it is, its still a classic must play for Total War players and any strategy game player. 
Runs really well no issues. 
Highly recommend!
spent countless hours on vanilla then discovered the dlc's which adds so much flavour this game! almost 20 years old this game but i always come back to it

Total War Medieval 2 is a great medieval strategy game, the game is old but still holds up to this day and the gameplay is really fun, it has a lot of factions to play as, such as the Byzantines which I still can't bring to it's former glory however that aside, the game is still great and very fun
Base game gets boring after a few playthroughs, but there are a lot of great mods that expand the life of this game.

It is not just a war game. You make great armies to crush and conquer other nations. However besides that I like detailed the game is, such as trading/diplomacy/assasination/spying. While you are building a city or town you can focus on military aspects or growth/agricaulture or art etc...

At the time this game came out, it definitely had the most realistic simulation of full army medieval battles. The campaign is a bit lacking in certain aspects but not a complete failure. It's a game about war and domination so expect extremely limited diplomacy and trade features. Extremely satisfying to command such large armies and watch the individual units behave so realistically, most of the time. The first in the series to feature differently textured soldiers in the same unit. Mods gave a lot of life to the game for decades. Overall a great game that left its mark in history but can be improved upon.
Nostalgic overload, really fun, turn based game where you try and take over the world, highly recommend.
The game is old, but it still stands up. Great design and balance of strategy and tactics.

Ive played plenty of the other total war titles and countless other rts games but none compare to this. its like creative assembly found the golden formula with this one. i still havent even dabbled in mods yet and i already know itll make me add hundreds and hundreds of more hours. something about the first 70-80 turns of any campaign i play is so magical. im running a scotland campaign where i play as ruthless highlanders that are bent on all out war and i want to find a mod to make the game more difficult because im tired of winning every single battle XD

Very good game. The graphics are much worse than those of later games (for obvious and understandable reasons). Additionally, diplomacy with foreign nations requires actually moving diplomats to their different settlements, which kind of sucks, but it is more realistic than other games.
I absolutely love this game. I definitely wish if there were more things in it, more developments, etc but one of the best ever!
First great Total War game. With current decadence of the franchise returning to the old titles such as MW2 is a must.

At 25+ years old, this game (all 5 including the Kingdoms expansion) are incredibly fun, rich with strategy and incredibly funny to listen to once you have a leader that builds up enough dread.  The speeches before battle always give me a laugh.  The history, accuracy of units and the smooth mechanics make any campaign, even one on the loosing side, a great deal of fun.  I also enjoy the AI opponents that make smart decisions not just random actions.  As you increase difficulty, get ready for an enjoyably challenging campaign.
This game is amazing because it is very tactical. I can do a variety of stuff

Total War: Medieval II is peak Total War energy, brutal battles, addicting campaigns, and enough medieval chaos to keep you up way past a responsible bedtime. Despite its age, it still plays like a classic that refuses to retire.
Pretty unintuitive if your coming from newer total war games but genuinely exellent and dose a lot of cool stuff that later games dont (also the mods are great)

A classic game.  Excellent replay value.  It definitely improved on other Total War games.  I might even say that this is the best Total War Game ever made, but I am partial to Rome II, but this is definitely good.

Absolute classic in dire need of a remaster. The controls are just unbearable compared to modern Total War titles. Amazing game if you can get past that though! It was my introduction to the TW series years ago.
You have not truly lived till you have played this game. It's better than ice cream, it's better than tacos, it's MEDIEVAL TWO, TOTAL WAR. The mod scene alone makes this game a must have

This game is an absolute classic, if you can pick it up for cheap i'd definitely recommend it!
It does suffer from crashes sometimes due to being old, but that doesnt happen often unless you're using mods.

Easily my favourite of all the nice Total Wars out there. Love the medieval settings. I have been playing these since the first game in the franchise came out. Played them all but the latest two Warhammer ones. All are good, recommendable games if you like the style.
All the things, one of the first computer games I ever played and still playing to this day.

i started with warhammer 3, then went to shogun 2, then napoleon, then thrones of britannia and finally here. If you mod the game its on par with master of strategy from shogun 2 imo. Playing older games makes me wonder wtf went wrong at CA with its most recent titles lol

It took me 59 hours to complete my first campaign and I feel like I barely scratched the surface of what this game has to offer, the value (Quantity x quality) of this game is probably unimaginable for many younger gamers that only played the slop churned out in the last 10 years, it is clearly a Must-have. 
On the other hand the game mechanics, althogh for the most part intuitive, require the committment of considerable attention and patience to get used to.

negative.review: This game is extremely outdated. If you want a more fluid experience try a newer title.

Fun game but unfortunately quite bugged due to poor programming or alterations to the base disc game.

Given the order, units will often, too often charge the first units in los instead of the unit selected. They get stuck on walls sometimes, not very responsive.

Diplomacy is a hot mess. People will declare war on you, betray you even. Papaucy will always be mad at you and threatening you with excommunication. Diplomacy is so scuffed that Papaucy refused a settlement in exchange for an alliance while I had outstanding relations with them and a Pope from my faction. The settlement was next to them, just for them to ally the following turn with a faction they hated and which was my enemy.

For all the Paradox players out there, if you complain about anti-player bias know that you will find it there times 10.

I cannot recommend the vanilla version of the Steam game.

Buggy, messy, not recommended. Units have pathfinding issues everywhere. Balance of the game makes it highly inaccurate historically.

This has to be one of the weakest releases from Creative Assembly.
This is just rubbish - not as terrible as TW:Napoleon, but still profoundly silly and inept
